meanings.definition: To have exclusive control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The greedy company monopolized all the cookies, leaving none for the other kids.
meanings.sent2: The billionaire businessman monopolized the entire industry, making it hard for new companies to compete.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel monopolized the bird feeder, not sharing any seeds with the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her loud voice monopolized the conversation, drowning out all other speakers.
meanings.sent5: The dictator monopolized all the power, leaving the citizens with no say in their own country.

meanings.definition: To dominate or control a market or industry.
meanings.sent1: The big corporation monopolized the toy market, making it difficult for smaller shops to survive.
meanings.sent2: The tech giant monopolized the smartphone industry, releasing new models every year.
meanings.sent3: The cat monopolized the sunny spot on the couch, refusing to let the dog share.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter monopolized the room, spreading joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The famous singer monopolized the music charts, with every new song becoming an instant hit.
